title: Gro Harlem Brundtland | Biography & Facts | Britannica

quotes: from 1974 to 1979, and she was first elected to the Storting (parliament) in 1977.
she was first elected to the Storting (parliament) in 1977.
In 1975 she was elected deputy leader of the party
in 1981 its leader.
When the Labour prime minister resigned in 1981, Brundtland was appointed to the post
She returned as prime minister in 1986–89
served again in 1990–96 until her resignation.
In 1983 Brundtland became chair of the UN World Commission on Environment and Development
which in 1987 issued Our Common Future
In 1998 she became director general of the WHO
her term ended in 2003.
In 2007 she became a member of the Elders
She held the post until 2010.
On July 22, 2011, Brundtland was the target of an assassination attempt.
